googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined:
* Depending on the type of election being conducted, you may early vote during the 7 or 15 days prior to Election Day.

* In most counties, early voting is conducted at the county clerk’s office.

* In counties with off-site early voting (a location other than the county clerk’s office), local newspapers will publish the designated sites.

* During a preferential primary or a general election, early voting is available between the hours of 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., Monday through Friday, and 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday, ending at 5 p.m. on the Monday before the election. Off-site early voting hours may vary by county; watch your local newspaper or contact your county clerk for information.
* During all other elections, early voting is available during your county clerk’s regular office hours.

* If your name or address has changed, you may update your information at the early voting site.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRulesCombined:
* You must provide an excuse to vote by mail in Arkansas, but 100% of voters can use COVID-19 as an excuse.
* If you are voting by mail due to COVID, check the box that says "unavoidably absentee on Election Day" on the request form.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Arkansas voters must provide their Arkansas driver's license number, state ID number, or the last four digits of their social security number with their voter registration application. Voters must also physically show valid ID, such as their driver's license or birth certificate.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Arkansas you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * live in Arkansas at the address in Box 2 on the application
  * be at least 18 years old before the next election
  * If you have been convicted of a felony, you must have completed your entire sentence (including probation and parole) and paid any fines, fees, or restitution to register to vote. If you are re-registering to vote for the first time after your felony, you must provide proof of completion of your sentence along with a voter registration form.
  * not claim the right to vote in any other jurisdiction
  * not previously be adjudged mentally incompetent by a court of competent jurisdiction
